question: Which country houses the "Bijol Islands"?
explanation: Bijol Islands is a group of islets in the West African state of The Gambia. The small uninhabited island group Bijol Islands is in the Atlantic Ocean. The five-islets group lies about two and a half to three-and-a-half kilometres off the coast at Bald Cape north of the village Tanji in the district Kombo South. They form the westernmost territory of Gambia.
